meanings.definition: A loud, harsh noise or fanfare.
meanings.sent1: The tantaras of the fire alarm startled everyone in the building.
meanings.sent2: The band played a triumphant tantaras at the end of the parade.
meanings.sent3: The tantaras of the car horn made the cat jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The tantaras of the thunderstorm echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The tantaras of the trumpet filled the room with excitement.

meanings.definition: A noisy, confused situation or uproar.
meanings.sent1: The tantaras of voices in the crowded market made it hard to hear.
meanings.sent2: There was a tantaras of laughter and chatter at the party.
meanings.sent3: The tantaras of the children playing outside was music to her ears.
meanings.sent4: In the tantaras of the city streets, she found peace in the park.
meanings.sent5: The tantaras of the protest could be heard from blocks away.
